E99D2DCBD8CF4B11820B23707DEF5820.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of line symmetry by:
identifying symmetrical 2-D shapes
creating symmetrical 2-D shapes
drawing one or more lines of symmetry in a 2-D shape.

50BE30F03B304173968418398C66C739.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of rectangular and triangular prisms by:
identifying common attributes
comparing
constructing models.

5CD9211C8C4B4433BE0FE0C86BD4DF11.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of area of regular and irregular 2-D shapes by:
recognizing that area is measured in square units
selecting and justifying referents for the units cm² or m²
estimating area by using referents for cm² or m²
determining and recording area (cm² or m²)
constructing different rectangles for a given area (cm² or m²) in order to demonstrate that many different rectangles may have the same area.

A668B7E4CCC54CFCA94FBEC12788EDEF.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of time by:
reading and recording time using digital and analog clocks (including 24 hour clocks)
reading and recording calendar dates in a variety of formats.

E9FB3E7742A64E9DBE4CAEDB14DAA40B.description: Represent and solve a multiplication or division problem involving equal grouping or partitioning (equal sharing) using a symbol to represent the unknown.

C23C599B07BD41EEB3EB3FD06EA251D6.description: Represent and solve an addition or subtraction problem involving a "part-part-whole" or comparison context using a symbol to represent the unknown.

BC974B2C224840F8B59BD254EE5DDF57.description: Explain what is meant by "one-step equation with one unknown".

F458BDE4CAB740B68C7048F37ED21429.description: Solve a one-step equation using guess and test.

75E40305F1DF4D84BA808021D7EFF98A.description: Solve a one-step equation using manipulatives.

3D8B9B5B30C8446D923205C949326814.description: Create a problem in context for an equation with one unknown.

1160A8C4FFAF44D0A6607816EBB1BD21.description: Identify the unknown in a story problem, represent the problem with an equation, and solve the problem concretely, pictorially, or symbolically.

20DA96ACC4A6446DBBA0BD4C334E7527.description: Write an equation in symbolic form for a given pictorial or concrete representation.

6EE934901E414C49893E4A81A3E433CE.description: Explain the purpose of the symbol, such as a triangle or circle, in an addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division equation with one unknown (e.g. 36 ÷ _ = 6).

F096255070E94A88B7ED5868BB5B18AD.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of equations involving symbols to represent an unknown value by:
writing an equation to represent a problem
solving one step equations.

A7DAAB74097049FC8658485581DF6F7A.description: Identify and correct error(s) in a table or chart.

4FB346DF35BD44ADA060D7D2CBFF084D.description: Determine the missing element(s) in a table or chart and explain the strategies used.

B5ECA4EDB6704DB0BAD8D1921C584AE5.description: Identify and describe a variety of patterns in a multiplication chart.

96A4758D576A41678EAC39B5EC65B287.description: Solve a problem by using a chart or diagram to identify mathematical relationships.

D4BE7536BE0F472A9068B41D5243C6A8.description: Determine where new data belong in a Venn diagram.

3610EBC030AD46ACA0700D5AD5F284B2.description: Describe the relationship shown in a given Venn diagram when the circles intersect, when one circle is contained in the other, and when the circles are separate.

D3575F1070CE4E4FB83C91A9023CD303.description: Identify the sorting rule for a Venn diagram.

E279F59EAB6E4511AB93657AA6B81030.description: Determine where new data belong in a Carroll diagram.

B4D3CA24327D471E85915DE7B15E4784.description: Solve a problem by completing a Carroll diagram using given data.

041CD226B91F41239D59CF558A804CFB.description: Identify and extend the patterns in a table or chart to solve a problem.

4E79BBC341F345AEB4BE2716DADD2221.description: Translate the information provided in a problem into a table or chart.

733E03AB7D4F4C509ACA67B0B7C6F080.description: Extend patterns found in a table or chart to solve a problem.

704C8027BDA146DDAE239A13B3F5D45F.description: Explain why the same relationships exist within a pattern in a table and its concrete representation.

49B8C705CF6C4A38ADD9E2134449824F.description: Create a concrete representation of a pattern displayed in a table or chart.

2943D5DB543549FBAC9A968D860C390E.description: Describe the pattern found in a table or chart.

FB3C5E5D2EB74240B76F61B417DA3332.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of patterns and relations by:
identifying and describing patterns and relations in a chart, table or diagram
reproducing patterns and relations in a chart, table, or diagram using manipulatives
creating charts, tables, or diagrams to represent patterns and relations
solving problems involving patterns and relations

C3558C9B14FC4C48954EE867599562D7.description: Represent a sum or difference of two decimals concretely or pictorially, and record the solution to the sum or difference symbolically.

C5DAD3DEE7634BE192F74991623C67DF.description: Explain the strategies used to determine a sum or difference.

BB51CA502F374DA080FC8BACF0D3674D.description: Count back change for a purchase.

E67C5EA494544C7C9EB2C4DB6712B375.description: Estimate a sum or difference using compatible numbers.

D4FA27583D944819AA000CEEDA880A60.description: Determine the approximate solution of a problem not requiring an exact answer.

4F29C2931167457087739B1D380EDA90.description: Solve problems, including money problems, which involve addition and subtraction of decimals, limited to hundredths.

74ECCBBE130E4ECF90C2E5D5FBC873CE.description: Approximate sums and differences of decimals using estimation strategies.

755AC7A35AE744D9BC60A4966FCB81C1.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of addition and subtraction of decimals limited to hundredths (concretely, pictorially, and symbolically) by:
using compatible numbers
estimating sums and differences
using mental math strategies
solving problems.

695FE56139E44FAFA423669AFA2048DC.description: Express orally and in symbolic form the decimal equivalent for a fraction (e.g., 50/100 can be expressed as 0.50).

7736A73F98C84BFDB6B2E6A52EC301F3.description: Express a pictorial or concrete representation as a fraction or decimal (e.g., 15 shaded squares on a hundred grid can be expressed as 0.15 or 15/100).

7B7F8C9F6AB943C79B94E7615864E5B0.description: Express orally and in symbolic form a fraction with a denominator of 10 or 100 as a decimal.

DFB72757B0D242C2A2CF82ED20304EED.description: Express orally and in symbolic form a decimal in fractional form.

FE52EC017E3B454581AC55961A0F4409.description: Read and write decimals as fractions (e.g., 0.5 is zero and five tenths).

26D399DB937742039DD259E537FF64B8.description: Model, using manipulatives or pictures, that a tenth can be expressed as hundredths (e.g., 0.9 is equivalent to 0.90 or 9 dimes is equivalent to 90 pennies).

51D26BDD1FF04453A6375CB020887C3B.description: Provide examples of everyday contexts in which tenths and hundredths are used.

A3C7D97DDD2743BC8F3BA4BD6AD264FA.description: Record a money value using decimals.

8E0073A9842840608D15E6DD6B01C067.description: Represent a decimal using money (dimes and pennies).

EE4B5B94F5354754B079C3AEDF739A96.description: Explain the meaning of each digit in a given decimal with all digits the same.

8C4A9B644A454CBD8D8F32DCA94F12CA.description: Represent a decimal concretely or pictorially.

D1B0F08ECD25494B8F71AE0BB068264B.description: Write the decimal for a concrete or pictorial representation of part of a set, part of a region, or part of a unit of measure.

F028C65FE6C04AF5827DCA9C29A88522.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of decimal numbers in tenths and hundredths (pictorially, orally, in writing, and symbolically) by:
describing
representing
relating to fractions.

A255F64D34E54A0C8FD9C9F499884CC8.description: Provide an example of a fraction that represents part of a set, a fraction that represents part of a whole, or a fraction that represents part of a length from everyday contexts.

79B15B69AA9A4846B1EF15DA393460D1.description: Provide examples of when two identical fractions may not represent the same quantity (e.g., half of a large apple is not equivalent to half of a small apple; half a group of ten cloudberries is not equivalent to half of a group of sixteen cloudberries).

E5050844F523405E8BC50E72E9FA9738.description: Order a set of fractions by placing them on a number line with given benchmarks.

FEB5DEE8AB0C414E94C408FFB70DF744.description: Name fractions between two benchmarks on a number line.

B2B8FEBF5DC04AD389B4A3D7BBC56FED.description: Identify which of the benchmarks 0, 1/2 or 1 is closer to a given fraction.

57ADE88FD17C42C897F9BD771E251AFA.description: Order a set of fractions that have the same denominator and explain the ordering.

ABDE6FFB3CF04AF6A9667F938E17A116.description: Order a set of fractions that have the same numerator and explain the ordering.

585B9430FC62421D81A04E58A2605DF0.description: Explain how denominators can be used to compare two unit fractions with numerator 1.

2C2EF75631CD41A6A6A23550EE98FF2D.description: Represent a fraction pictorially by indicating parts of a whole.

277F1819026841D8B2A2A6E46C8E03F2.description: Represent a fraction pictorially by indicating parts of a given set.

C17168289B7F48CEBE1210B9B7806F31.description: Name and record the shaded and non-shaded (included and not included) parts of a whole.

00CD1460D7ED40DDA0080D00BF722C74.description: Name and record the fraction for the included and not included parts of a set.

BCA2E4ED688147E6B7814734B2517B4A.description: Represent a fraction based on a symbolically concrete representation (e.g., circles for cookies).

3C2DDDF373464127A8893F94E25C7C6C.description: Represent a fraction using concrete materials.

64675D4A225043E4B82231E78BA294D8.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of fractions less than or equal to one by using concrete and pictorial representations to:
name and record fractions for the parts of a whole or a set
compare and order fractions
model and explain that for different wholes, two identical fractions may not represent the same quantity
provide examples of where fractions are used.

9847AA154629468BB67EC3DE6A61AD7E.description: Explain, using examples, the relationship between division and multiplication.

50F94322E6384544A2BB1A3C9EC47DEA.description: Explain the property for determining the answer when dividing numbers by one.

269CBECAB83848208FF12FB36ECBA79A.description: Estimate a quotient using a personal strategy (e.g., 86 ÷ 4 is close to 80 ÷ 4 or close to 80 ÷ 5).

4DCE81D51B004B9EA99CD53457FA5B6C.description: Create and solve a word problem involving a 1- or 2-digit dividend (the number being divided into).

0559B7344BC949ACBE3F9497CD5A4796.description: Solve a division problem using a personal strategy and record the process symbolically.

AEEB9444721F4F548A26644A3B41E37B.description: Solve a division problem with a remainder using arrays or base ten materials.

9F4BEAF3683A4950909357FEACB2D6BA.description: Solve a division problem without a remainder using arrays or base ten materials.

00BA045CBB604DA386086429380C2629.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of division (1-digit divisor and up to 2-digit dividend) to solve problems by:
using personal strategies for dividing with and without concrete materials
estimating quotients
explaining the results of dividing by 1
solving problems involving division of whole numbers
relating division to multiplication.

D0208EB887B541E58AD0F95211511392.description: Solve a multiplication problem and explain the strategies or processes used.

7E0C7962760B48AAB40DE98F32365948.description: Model and solve a multiplication problem using an array, and record the process.

E5BB57C367A54D73AE9938A388E7AD61.description: Estimate a product using a personal strategy (e.g., 2 × 243 is close to or a little more than 2 × 200, or close to or a little less than 2 × 250).

6A05E6E6D4414C099C4CE6DD565208EB.description: Create and solve a multiplication problem that is limited to a 2- or 3-digit number times a 1-digit number.

CC7DC9AEB02E49FF968DC9613A14BC7F.description: Use concrete materials, such as base ten blocks or their pictorial representations, to represent multiplication and record the process symbolically.

82D8F92BA5904409B8D4965D10F39AB3.description: Model a multiplication problem (concretely or symbolically) using the distributive property (e.g., 8 × 365 = (8 × 300) + (8 × 60) + (8 × 5)).

2EF4EAF447A04C59907F3CA67D830F81.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of multiplication (2- or 3-digit by 1-digit) by:
using personal strategies for multiplication, with and without concrete materials
using arrays to represent multiplication
connecting concrete representations to symbolic representations
estimating products
solving problems.

34104CBFD3A2474B977DA1EAC62FADFC.description: Explain the property for determining the answer when multiplying numbers by zero.

1A6062CFFC114C2FB86F3593C15F44C9.description: Explain the property for determining the answer when multiplying numbers by one.

A27AEE86F851411283CEAC70CC0C9DD3.description: Explain the strategy used to determine a product.

6FC45BD2266440BF89AFC7424418547F.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of multiplication of whole numbers (limited to numbers less than or equal to 10) by:
applying mental mathematics strategies
explaining the results of multiplying by 0 and 1

9485A9873B33440AA3526CBEC1D3097F.description: Solve problems that involve addition and subtraction of more than two numbers.

7FDA5839AF3D43169286E69893BBA17E.description: Explain the strategies used to determine a sum or difference.

616C0871273C40E19589DA5E13DC080B.description: Estimate sums and differences using different strategies (e.g., front-end estimation and compensation).

302F98CD84F243E08AC506B5F297564A.description: Describe a situation in which an estimate rather than an exact answer is sufficient.

AC7E183A9775479F93BE4F8FE21E4ACF.description: Explain how to keep track of digits that have the same place value when adding or subtracting numbers.

D30657DCEB6740EBB1123CE01D8C2F14.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of addition of whole numbers with answers to 10 000 and their corresponding subtractions (limited to 3 and 4-digit numerals) by:
using personal strategies for adding and subtracting
estimating sums and differences
solving problems involving addition and subtraction.

623BAB40A40E491084720EC96F09E721.description: Explain why two or more number compositions represent the same quantity.

DCA0496D700A4C448C9751113FEA4BC0.description: Decompose and represent a 4-digit number at least three different ways.

D3156E56BC1B4907B68CADDF505E96DA.description: Identify incorrectly placed numbers in an ordered sequence or shown on a number line.

8568D5CACD2C4E04A4F9832E21806D65.description: Identify the missing numbers in an ordered sequence or shown on a number line.

FFC5AB5B191D4F86963DF338AEEC137D.description: Create and order three different 4-digit numerals.

DDE5724B30EA447D9DB4A09F64AF5553.description: Order a set of numbers in ascending or descending order, and explain the order by making references to place value.

04AA86E1C7714A74828CFF34CF9B1636.description: Explain the meaning of each digit in a 4-digit number representing a particular quantity.

7E18D5606AFE4542B52345300DFD8927.description: Explain and show the meaning of each digit in a 4-digit numeral with all digits the same (e.g., for the numeral 2222, the first digit represents two thousands, the second digit two hundreds, the third digit two tens, and the fourth digit two ones).

AB3FAF41754342D9B7C5DA69C8B702AA.description: Write the numeral represented by an expanded notation expression.

3DC310F77FCE46D4ADC70D36ED2D531D.description: Express a numeral in expanded notation (e.g., 321 = 300 + 20 + 1).

70175DBA0E02485CBB1EDC88B509EFB1.description: Explain the meaning of each digit in a numeral.

E77C0721433F4A70AEDE08DD92D8C7C0.description: Represent a numeral using a place value chart or diagrams.

1D5C905C4A5E41D88B3B42700022A8A2.description: Write a numeral using proper spacing without commas (e.g., 4567 or 4 567, 10 000).

DBAE1319FD9742A5B057D0988BEAFCE0.description: Read a four-digit numeral without using the word "and" (e.g., 5321 is five thousand three hundred twenty one, NOT five thousand three hundred AND twenty one).

0EC04B7CC55A4E999B908398BF5A546A.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of whole numbers to 10 000 (pictorially, physically, orally, in writing, and symbolically) by:
representing
describing
comparing two numbers
ordering three or more numbers.

6140BFC2054A45AE9B536F813F1A97FC.description: Reflect on own strategies for viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing and set goals to improve the strategies used.

0582CAD3455C447D8D9087A0A92E84D7.description: Ask questions such as "What do I already know? What can I already do? What strategies have I learned? What do I need to remember? What goals do I need to set for myself?"

13DC6CD550DB4021881CD1A6D37224A5.description: Reflect on viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing by explaining what is effective or what worked in a text.

9C28B3059C30415792158D4B2F3F3E4F.description: Set and pursue personal goals to improve viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing tasks more effectively.

2431AF8F0C1D43F0A1821E185A6A7C22.description: Reflect on own strategies for viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing and set goals to improve the strategies used.

CB3DEBA38BC24152A59437211E1BE25E.description: Ask questions such as "What do I already know? What can I already do? What strategies have I learned? What do I need to remember? What goals do I need to set for myself?"

BC332E93C8944709B7F576D3AC0DA021.description: Reflect on viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing by explaining what is effective or what worked in a text.

E84841C3EE834DB8BA13270D0CD5F1D9.description: Reflect on and assess own viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing experiences, the selected strategies employed (e.g., using class-generated criteria), and explore possible ways to improve.

971ED5FE192C4633AEA44637B5922C3F.description: Communicate and demonstrate understanding by creating original texts (e.g., poem, play, letter, journal entry) and by writing responses to texts, supporting judgements through references to both the text and prior knowledge.

E104833735214B69852CBFECE9A6F996.description: Write summaries that contain the main ideas of the text or presentation and the most significant details.

9E77ECDC7B6843359738ACCF96AF4D31.description: Write procedures with clear directions and explanations.

7EE80DEFFD18498098F5C660EDD51B5F.description: Write information reports (3-5 paragraphs) that focus on a central question about an issue or situation, include facts and details, and draw from more than one source of information (e.g., speakers, books, newspapers, other sources).

A03D2CE4459645DD93F11A9BDB9ABA45.description: Write descriptions and narratives (3-5 paragraphs) that relate observations and recollections of an event or experience and use sensory details.

7B80CFAC5B424E978DDA2427EE4B56F5.description: Create compositions with an introductory paragraph that establishes a central idea in key sentence(s), supporting paragraphs with simple facts, details, and explanations, and a concluding paragraph that summarizes the points.

61FA24DC91234F04A62326F0BF8A2C34.description: Write clear, coherent sentences and paragraphs that develop a central idea.

5367C94D506A4A928CE60808F14D5BFA.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to communicate meaning when writing.

5245DCD898B7411A9958C32C79686E1D.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when writing.

0A823022FE264914B875168387AC7058.description: Work through the stages of a writing process (e.g., pre-writing, drafting, revising successive versions).

4C2550F1AC7E41D1BF54F4D24036CF1D.description: Use a writing process to produce descriptive, narrative, and expository compositions that focus on a central idea, have a logical order, explain point of view, and give reasons or evidence.

8AB77D1D132044F0922C4C27E90077A8.description: Make individual contributions to class discussion by expressing ideas, opinions, and feelings and interact with others to share ideas and opinions, ask for support, complete tasks, and explain concerns or problems.

9ED7BC4389964E1EA3DE0219727B898F.description: Recite brief poems (e.g., two or three stanzas), monologues, or dramatic dialogues using clear diction, tempo, volume, and phrasing.

602DF43F6CA44162B5477FE7D99A6D80.description: Deliver oral summaries that contain the main ideas and the most significant details of articles and books.

C9B4F6353A3B4CF1861BB5747216BD26.description: Make informational presentations that frame a key question, include facts and details that help listeners to focus, and incorporate more than one source of information (e.g., interviews, books, newspaper articles, and television or radio reports).

7E88CFD8DD7342D8ACB6133B5A4FA34D.description: Make narrative presentations that retell a traditional First Nations and Métis narrative.

751C38D4C7F941A39B9BFF64B53FE5DF.description: Make narrative presentations that relate ideas, observations, or recollections about an event or experience, provide a context that enables the listener to imagine the circumstances of the event or experience, and provide insight into why the selected event or experience is memorable.

43400CCF00D048D3B4D10012BD6DEBD9.description: Present effective introductions and conclusions that guide the listener's understanding of important ideas and evidence, use appropriate structure for conveying key information (e.g., cause and effect, similarity and difference), and use details, examples, anecdotes, or experiences to explain or clarify information.

27708C37A60F49C4907E5E36CCAF8338.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to communicate meaning when speaking.

6BEC31C154A14C74BF8743C7273CD06C.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when speaking.

D9F19BE2FA384709B40DD758293FD4A4.description: Adapt language and presentation style to the purpose and needs of the audience, and guide the listener to understand important ideas by using proper phrasing, pitch, and modulation.

F1329BF140934BB7B1092F27A575B32F.description: Speak to present and express a range of ideas and information in formal and informal speaking situations (including giving oral explanations, delivering brief reports or speeches, demonstrating and describing procedures) for differing audiences and purposes.

9D976BA73E2D428F97C19049CB77B89D.description: Experiment with different ways of representing ideas and sharing them with others (e.g., drama, mime, tableau, dance, music, models, painting).

57FA85C842654AE5906BD1A6133DB8B8.description: Use visual aids (e.g., pictograms, graphs, charts, tables, diagrams, maps, illustrations, movement) to enhance spoken or written products.

E6E3CF6AF734454FBB7C66F99A85E846.description: Express relevant opinions about experiences (e.g., an incident) through a variety of representations (e.g., multimedia presentation, role play).

CD4A9BA4B23645CBB3DA126C09500424.description: Organize information and ideas in visual and multimedia texts that are clear, meaningful, logical, and illustrative of the topic and are properly labelled and captioned.

C9C40BD9B329466D98F5CB9F2EA86FBE.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to communicate meaning when using other forms of representing.

5507890D328042F5A5E359B5CB2BC4A1.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to communicate meaning when using other forms of representing

6792091AD3154925A030F4A439DA78CB.description: Use a variety of visuals (e.g., chart, diagram) to communicate essential information when making an oral presentation.

64FD0E8F413B4313A55C0902F1DDBEAA.description: Create a variety of clear representations that communicate straightforward ideas and information relevant to the topic and purpose, including short, illustrated reports, dramatizations, posters, and other visuals such as displays and drawings.

24DB02A3216F4B73ADB2E5BC2BF5D761.description: Use inquiry to explore authentic problems, questions, and issues associated with identity, community, and social responsibility including: asking general and specific inquiry questions on topics using predetermined categories, recording, selecting, and sharing relevant personal knowledge and understanding of a topic or questions and considering purpose for individual and group inquiry or research, selecting and using a plan for gathering ideas and information, assessing the usefulness, authenticity, and reliability of information for inquiry or research needs using pre-established criteria, using a variety of tools (including indices, maps, atlases, charts, electronic sources) and resources to access ideas and information, organizing ideas and information in logical sequences, making notes and citing authors and titles of sources alphabetically, examining collected information to identify categories or aspects of a topic that need more research, sharing findings and conclusions in a clear visual, oral, and written format, using the language of inquiry (e.g., "I want to know if .…", "I wonder about ….").

896D7C00383E4B76917E5FD65F9C5C47.description: Compose and communicate findings and conclusions about problems, questions, or issues in a clear visual, oral, and written format.

7D57CA1E05844BD18BA714320C5F8606.description: Create spoken, written, and other representations that include: a specific message, a coherent organization of ideas, ideas and information which are clear and complete, appropriate use of language and conventions.

5C5F53B0E20644ADA1E2E70C543F8080.description: Compose and create a range of visual, multimedia, oral, and written texts that explore: identity (e.g., Expressing Myself) community (e.g., Celebrating and Honouring Others) social responsibility (e.g., Within My Circle) through personal experiences and inquiry.

F22A9989A66C414F98D042EA2B323F5D.description: Read grade-appropriate texts silently (e.g., 20 minutes; 135-185 wcpm) and orally (with fluency, accuracy, pacing, intonation, and expression; 100-140 wcpm), adjusting reading rates to the complexity of the materials and the purpose for reading.

6FFCE193E029404E89B75A2369BE0A10.description: Support opinions and conclusions about what is read.

0FBC7127F017423687C80003AE92ABF9.description: Read and use grade four reference texts (e.g., dictionary, encyclopedia, how-to, explanations, biography) for inquiry and to identify main ideas, details, opinions, and reasons.

6516918DD2404DC4854806442A65459E.description: Follow multi-step written instructions and procedures in basic technical or how-to manuals (e.g., how to play a video game).

A3D750D334A4473B8D4BB61136565FCE.description: Compare information on the same topic after reading several passages or articles.

5EB8A7BDA4DC4B6BA731159C093DCCBB.description: Read for information in content area resources and reference materials and recognize the variety of expository text structures including compare-contrast, problem-solution, cause and effect, time sequence, and description.

E4B6877F85EE46E99F90D79417E3BC6D.description: Read and summarize narrative texts including First Nations and Métis narratives and identify characters' traits, characters' changes over time, and the theme.

2EDE89D1492A4368889AB00E04AB20DC.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to construct and confirm meaning when reading.

C89D71B1D07C4F7EBC5E2457826DEA89.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when reading.

21C75179D6484E24BE1F846F0B5F8957.description: Recognize and explain the author's ideas, explicit and implicit message, and techniques (e.g., use of figurative language).

0D56AF5F959C463D920A1240F8296F2A.description: Read for various purposes and demonstrate comprehension of grade-appropriate fiction (including stories and novels), scripts, poetry, and non-fiction (including magazines, reports, instructions, and procedures) from various cultures including First Nations and Métis and countries (including Canada).

BA070FD4B8A84DE5B28872C547ACDF09.description: Draw conclusions supported by ideas presented.

7662E37EE4AF40BF83AE8E265ACD73D3.description: Follow multi-step directions and instructions independently.

1228383DAE1240AC8EA88EC6ED4AD384.description: Summarize and paraphrase major ideas and supporting evidence presented in spoken messages and formal presentations.

220D66BFE2B440C5B4FDDDA582CA6E45.description: Ask thoughtful questions that probe deeper thought and respond to questions with elaboration.

FD9E4AC20BB847B79A36E72E8930C96F.description: Distinguish between verifiable fact and opinion and analyze the message and presentation for evidence.

D2FDEA3AB1794C79936CCA8DB37792CC.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to construct and confirm meaning when listening.

F54D53CC683547878DB7BD5B63EBD40E.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when listening.

0C61A4C779EE40139313E967AF35288F.description: Listen critically and respond appropriately to a range of oral communications including oral traditions passed on by First Nations Elders and Knowledge Keepers.

80824405EA92489FAB227E4958B9E4FB.description: Listen, summarize, paraphrase, and evaluate what was listened to and draw conclusions.

6846B7079A3D448CBBEE221BE928F72D.description: View a multimedia presentation and identify how the language, visual, and multimedia features (e.g., sound, colour, movement) are used to persuade.

8947BD8EDCA9493DA9AE311F51362374.description: Understand how a range of visual features (e.g., graphs, images, illustrations, charts, maps, diagrams) can enhance and clarify spoken, written, or silent messages.

DD994EC800DD4C19A3B4CD2B2E3F3C71.description: Identify, with support, the values and aspects of various cultures' underlying visual messages including First Nations and Métis art and other texts.

F61F7326EF854F628DD38E96CABABD4E.description: Identify the intent and appeal of particular TV and print advertisements and other visuals including First Nations and Métis art and other texts.

8819ED3C8D4D4D79BFEA5E8F41513139.description: Evaluate the role of visuals in focusing attention on particular aspects or events, and influencing opinions on issues.

6183723E6537453F881FEF212B3353DE.description: Understand and apply cues and conventions including pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and others to construct and confirm meaning when viewing.

61BE0B5373EC430C88C3F95F3FCF80A6.description: Select and use pertinent before, during, and after strategies to construct meaning when viewing.

9DBFA797D8D249FBB33DB56E8865AAE4.description: Discuss visual experiences (e.g., what was seen and the effectiveness).

198B9E841FBC489094410F93D8124825.description: View and respond to visual and multimedia texts (including graphs, charts, diagrams, maps, multimedia DVD, websites, television programs, advertisements, posters), explaining the creator's technique and the impact on viewers.

8A90009A6EB941C792A5570E5FA2B4F4.description: Identify cultural representations in oral, print, and other media texts from various communities including First Nations and Métis communities.

135F1B8845404E5F823687692FBBB933.description: Identify similarities and differences between personal experiences and the experiences of people from various cultures portrayed in a variety of texts including First Nations and Métis texts.

9EBABC6E55944817B9951776CA82178F.description: Connect the insights of an individual or individuals in texts to personal experiences.

971A74E158364FB1B4D43331CE6F3466.description: View, listen to, and read a variety of texts related to theme or topic of study and show comprehension by: retelling and explaining the ideas and information presented in texts, recognizing and understanding the text structures (e.g., narrative, informational, poetry) and features (e.g., description, figurative language, graphics), responding to and interpreting the texts, and explaining and supporting response with evidence from the texts.

4EF2CE17584E4056B6D06BABC7B37EDA.description: View, listen to, read, and respond to a variety of texts that reflect diverse personal identities, worldviews, and backgrounds (e.g., culture, age, gender, language) including First Nations and Métis texts.

B74954D2A780479A8C7195607689C9BB.description: Comprehend and respond to a variety of grade-level texts (including contemporary and traditional visual, oral, written, and multimedia texts) that address: identity (e.g., Expressing Myself) community (e.g., Building Community) social responsibility (e.g., Preserving a Habitat) and support response with evidence from text and from own experiences.
